Hibiscus 
 Loves sun and temperatures around 15-32°. Should be kept moist but not soggy. 
Needs fertilizing every few weeks. 
Watch out for aphids, whiteflies and spider mites! 

Difficulty : Hard

Elephantplant 
 Thrives in warm, humid environments with indirect sunlight. 
 Prefers well-draining soil and regular watering, but avoid overwatering. 
 Fertilize monthly during the growing season. 
 Watch out for root rot, mealybugs, and spider mites! 

Difficulty: Medium

Zebraplant 
 Requires bright, indirect light and consistently moist soil. 
 Avoid letting the soil dry out completely. Fertilize every two weeks during active growth.
 Watch out for leaf browning, powdery mildew, and spider mites! 

Difficulty: Hard

Ficusplant 
 Prefers bright, indirect sunlight but can tolerate some shade. 
 Keep soil consistently moist, but avoid waterlogging. 
 Fertilize once a month during the growing season. 
 Watch out for leaf drop, spider mites, and scale insects! 

Difficulty: Medium

Coleusplant 
 Thrives in bright, indirect light or partial sun. 
 Keep the soil evenly moist, but avoid overwatering. 
 Watch out for wilting, aphids, and whiteflies! 

Difficulty: Easy
